intro: Pedicularis trichomata, commonly known as the hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its specialized growth requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
